Setup v3 Script.description: Set basic format for a v3 script

Setup v4 Script.description: Set basic format for a v4 script

description: ObjectMain - Calls once every frame per object
if priority allows for it
ObjectDraw - Calls once every frame per object
if priority allows for it. The order is based
on the value of Object.DrawOrder
ObjectPlayerInteraction - Calls once every frame per object
if priority allows for it
and Player.ObjectInteractions is enabled
ObjectStartup - Calls once per object type
when the stage loads.
Used for loading sheets, SpriteFrames
and change behaviour based on property
ObjectUpdate - Calls once every frame per object
if priority allows for it
ObjectDraw - Calls once every frame per object
if priority allows for it. The order is based
on the value of Object.DrawOrder
ObjectStartup - Calls once per object type
when the stage loads.
Used for loading sheets, SpriteFrames
and change behaviour based on property

body: // -Indexed arrays can have a '+' or '-' added to refer to the next or previous in the level's object list
// -While their name give an indication of for what they should be used, the purpose of a variable is not set in stone
// -Be careful with usage of TempValue's, since they are used for all objects, a constant missuse of them can break behaviour of objects
// -Object.XPos and Object.YPos use floating points, the last 4 zeroes on the value are sub-pixel values
// -Due to how the engine works, using iXPos or iYPos at any point will truncate the sub-pixel value of XPos and YPos in the object

Add v3 callback aliases.description:
Add alias in script of the most used engine states
plus SET1P and 2P, which helps adding an AI player

Add v3 tileinfo aliases.description:
Add alias in script for usage in TileInfo funcs
FLAGSB and ANGLEB are read-only

Add v3 face flag aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage in FaceBuffer.Flag

Add v3 collision side aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with ObjectTileCollision

Add v3 collision mode aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with ObjectTileCollision

body: #alias 0 : PRIORITY_BOUNDS         // Object updates within 128 pixels of the screen border left/right and 256 pixels up/down
#alias 1 : PRIORITY_ACTIVE         // Object will always update, unless paused/frozen
#alias 3 : PRIORITY_XBOUNDS        // Object updates within 128 pixels of the screen border left/right
#alias 4 : PRIORITY_BOUNDS_DESTROY // Object updates within 128 pixels of the screen border left/right, object will be set to Blank Object if the check fails
Add v3 priority aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with Object.Priority

body: #alias 2 : INK_ALPHA  // Uses transparency value of Object.Alpha
#alias 3 : INK_ADD    // Uses transparency value of Object.Alpha, and a bright tint
#alias 4 : INK_SUB    // Uses transparency value of Object.Alpha, and a dark tint
Add v3 ink effect aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with Object.InkEffect

Add v3 misc aliases.description: Add alias in script for misc stuff

Add v4 tile info aliases.description:
Add alias in script for usage in TileInfo funcs
FLAGSB and ANGLEB are read-only

Add v4 face flag aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage in FaceBuffer.Flag

Add v4 collision side aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with ObjectTileCollision

Add v4 collision mode aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with ObjectTileCollision

body: private alias 0 : PRIORITY_BOUNDS         // Object updates within 128 pixels of the screen border left/right and 256 pixels up/down
private alias 1 : PRIORITY_ACTIVE         // Object will always update, unless paused/frozen
private alias 2 : PRIORITY_ALWAYS         // Object will always update
private alias 3 : PRIORITY_XBOUNDS        // Object updates within 128 pixels of the screen border left/right
private alias 4 : PRIORITY_BOUNDS_DESTROY // Object updates within 128 pixels of the screen border left/right, object will be set to Blank Object if the check fails
private alias 5 : PRIORITY_INACTIVE       // Object never updates
private alias 6 : PRIORITY_BOUNDS_SMALL   // Object updates within 32 pixels of the screen border left/right and 128 pixels up/down
private alias 7 : PRIORITY_ACTIVE_SMALL   // Object will always update, unless paused/frozen. The bounds ofobject.outOfBounds are much smaller
Add v4 priority aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with Object.Priority

body: private alias 1 : INK_BLEND  // Uses half transparency
private alias 2 : INK_ALPHA  // Uses transparency value of Object.Alpha
private alias 3 : INK_ADD    // Uses transparency value of Object.Alpha, and a bright tint
private alias 4 : INK_SUB    // Uses transparency value of Object.Alpha, and a dark tint
Add v4 inkeffect aliases.description: Add alias in script for usage with Object.InkEffect

description: Creates a new alias,it will
be replaced with var on compile time
#alias is the format used in v3 and is always private
public/private alias is v4's
Skip over lines of code if
type does not match with what
the bytecode is being compiled for.
Skip over lines of code if
type does not match with what
the bytecode is being compiled for.
Boolean expression.
makes CheckResult true if A is the same as B
Boolean expression.
makes CheckResult true if A is not the same as B
Boolean expression.
makes CheckResult true if A is greater than B
Boolean expression.
makes CheckResult true if A is lower than B
Switch statement
'default' is optional.
'break' is used to stop fallthrough
foreach statement
iterates every TypeName object
and sets 'store' to the object's slotID.
'type' by default are the available three
Loads an ogg formatted file from
Data/Music/[filePath] into trackList
slot trackID, with a loop point of loopPoint
(0 = no loop, 1 = loop from start, anything else is a sample to loop)

Play music.description: Plays the music track loaded into the slot trackID

Stop music.description: Stops the currently playing music track

Pause music.description: Pauses the currently playing music track

description: Similar to SetMusicTrack() and PlayMusic()
but starts at a position based on ratio.
ratio uses a 8000-based value
so 8000 = 1.0 music speed, 4000 = 0.5, etc.
Used more commonly with speed shoes

Play sfx.description: Plays the sfx with matching gameconfig index loopCount times

Stop sfx.description: Stops the sfx with matching gameconfig index

Play stage sfx.description: Plays the sfx with matching stageconfig index loopCount times

Stop stage sfx.description: Stops the sfx with matching stageconfig index

description: Sets the amount of times for sfx to loop to loopCount
(-1 to leave it unchanged) and the panning of sfx to pan
(-100 to 100 for left to right, with 0 being balanced)
Loads a spritesheet from Data/Sprites/[Filepath]
and sets Object.SpriteSheet to the sheet's ID

Remove SpriteSheet.description: Removes a sheet that matches Filepath if it exists

Add SpriteFrame.body: SpriteFrame(${3:int PivotX}, ${4:int PivotY}, ${5:int Width}, ${6:int Height}, ${7:int sprX}, ${8:int sprY})
Add SpriteFrame.description: Creates a spriteframe with the specified values

Edit SpriteFrame.body: EditSpriteFrame(${3:int frame}, ${4:int PivotX}, ${5:int PivotY}, ${6:int Width}, ${7:int Height}, ${8:int sprX}, ${9:int sprY})
description: Creates a spriteframe with the specified values
v3 only has this function available in HW mode

Draw Sprite in object position.description: Draw sprite frame at object's X and Y position

description: Draw sprite frame to a specified X and Y position
the position is interpreted as world-space (0x10000 = 1px)
Draw sprite frame to a specified X and Y position
the position is interpreted as screen-space (1px = 1px)
Draw sprite frame to a specified X and Y position
position is interpreted as world-space (0x10000 = 1px)
Draw sprite frame to a specified X and Y position
position is interpreted as screen-space (1 = 1px)
Draws a tinted rectangle with a size of width,height
at ixPos and iYPos

Draw Numbers.body: DrawNumbers(${3:int startingFrame}, ${4:int iXPos}, ${5:int iYPos}, ${6:int value}, ${7:int digitCnt}, ${8:int spacing}, ${9:bool showAllDigits})
description: Draws values using startingFrame as the
starting point at iXPos and iYPos
with spacing pixels between frames
if showAllDigits is false, only draw valid digits
otherwise, draw digitCnt digits with extras as 0

Draw Act Name.body: DrawActName(${3:int startingFrame}, ${4:int iXPos}, ${5:int iYPos}, ${6: int align}, ${7:bool allowLowerCase}, ${8:int space width}, ${9:int spacing})
description: Draws the loaded stage's act name using 26 frames
starting from startingFrame at iXPos and iYPos
with spacing pixels between each letter
align determines how the act name should be drawn
with 0 drawing the whole name, while 1 and 2 picks
the first and second words respectively and draw separate

(while v3 has access to this,
 CD titlecards don't use this system by default)

Draw rectangle.body: DrawRect(${3:int iXPos}, ${4:int iYPos}, ${5:int width}, ${6:int height}, ${7: int Red}, ${8: int Green}, ${9: int Blue}, ${10: int Alpha})
description:
Draws a rectangle with a size of width,height
at ixPos and iYPos,
with a color of Red, Green, Blue along Alpha
Loads an animation from Data/Animations/[AniPath]
for the object to use
Draws the player at it's X and Y position
based on the loaded animation and
Object.Frame/Object.Animation.
v3 Exclusive, merged with DrawObjectAnimation in v4
Draws the object at it's X and Y position
based on the loaded animation and
Object.Frame/Object.Animation.
Objects that use animation files cannot use transparency or scale
in v3 rotation is not possible on objects with
animation files aside from the player
Load a video with the name of VideoName
from Videos/. If the filename extension is .rsv
an RSV file will load instead

Next RSV Frame.description: Advances the video frame from an RSV file

Clear Draw List.description: Removes all entries in drawList layer

Add entity reference in Draw List.description: Adds ObjectPos to the drawList layer

description: Gets ObjectPos value in drawList layer
and stores it in store
Sets ObjectPos value in drawList layer
to the value of newValue

Load Palette.body: LoadPalette("${3:string filePath}", ${4:int palBankID}, ${5:int startPalIndex}, ${6:int startIndex}, ${7:int endIndex})
description: Loads a palette from Data/Palettes/[filePath]
into a palette bank starting from startPalIndex,
with a file offset of startIndex and reading all
colors through to endIndex
Rotates all colours in the palette bank
starting from startIndex through to endIndex,
it will move left if rotationDirection is 0
otherwise it will move right
Sets the fade out effect
based on Red, Blue, Green and Alpha values
Sets the active palette for palBankID
for all lines from startLine through to endLine
Sets the palette entry in palBankID
at palIndex to the value of 'color'
The format for color is 0xRRGGBB
Gets the palette entry in palBankID
at palIndex and stores it in palStore

Set Palette Fade.body: SetPaletteFade(${3:int destPalBankID}, ${4:int Red}, ${5:int Green}, ${6:int Blue}, ${7:int blendAmount}, ${8:int startIndex}, ${9:int endIndex})
description: Blends the currently active palette with
Red, Green and Blue by blendAmount,
and stores it in destPalBankID,
starting at palIndex and
continuing through to endIndex

v4 Copy Palette.body: CopyPalette(${3:int sourcePal}, ${4:int sourcePalStart}, ${5:int destPal}, ${6:int destPalStart}, ${7:int count})
description: Copies count colors from sourcePal
starting at sourcePalStart.
To destPal, starting at destPalStart
Clears all pixels on screen with
clearIndex color in the active palette
Creates a temporary object specified
by objectType, propertyValue, XPos and YPos
near the end of the object list and sets
TempObjectPos to the created object slotID.
This should only be used for misc objects
that aren't required for too long in the stage
Resets objectSlot object to the type

and position specified by type,
propertyValue, XPos and YPos

Check player collision w/ objects.body: PlayerObjectCollision(${3|C_TOUCH,C_BOX,C_BOX2,C_PLATFORM|}, ${4:int left HitBox}, ${5:int top HitBox}, ${6:int right HitBox}, ${7:int bottom HitBox})
description: Checks for a collision with the player
using the hitbox values passed.
CheckResult will be 0 if there wasn't collision
If C_TOUCH is used, any collision will be 1.
If C_BOX/C_BOX2 is used, CheckResult will be set to:
1(Floor), 2(LWall), 3(RWall) or 4(Roof),
depending of collision.
If C_PLATFORM is used, only top collision will set
CheckResult to 1.

Process Object Collision.description:
Handles tile collision of an object
(used almost only for player)

Check object collision w/ other object.body: BoxCollisionTest(${3|C_TOUCH,C_BOX,C_BOX2,C_PLATFORM|}, ${4:int thisObject}, ${5:int thisLeft}, ${6:int thisTop}, ${7:int thisRight}, ${8:int thisBottom}, ${9:int otherObject}, ${10:int otherLeft}, ${11:int otherTop}, ${12:int otherRight}, ${13:int otherBottom})
description: Checks for collision thisObject and otherObject
using the hitbox values passed.
CheckResult will be 0 if there wasn't collision
If C_TOUCH is used, any collision will be 1.
If C_BOX/C_BOX2 is used, CheckResult will be set to:
1(Floor), 2(LWall), 3(RWall) or 4(Roof),
depending of collision.
If C_PLATFORM is used, only top collision will set
CheckResult to 1.
Hitbox values can be set to 0x10000 and use
the object's active hitbox instead.
Tries to collide with the FG layer
based on the position of iXPos + xOffset, iYPos + yOffset.
Sets CheckResult to true if there was a collision,
otherwise it will be false.

This function is best used to check if a tile is there,
not to move along it

CSides are 0(CSIDE_FLOOR),1(CSIDE_LWALL),2(CSIDE_RWALL),
and 3(CSIDE_RWALL).
(Not confuse them with CModes)
Tries to collide with the FG layer
based on the position of iXPos + xOffset, iYPos + yOffset.
Sets CheckResult to true if there was a collision,
otherwise it will be false.
This function is best used to handle moving along surfaces

CSides are 0(CSIDE_FLOOR),1(CSIDE_LWALL),2(CSIDE_RWALL),
and 3(CSIDE_RWALL).
(Not confuse them with CModes)

Get object value.description:
Gets the Object[objectPos].Value
at index and stores it in store

Set object value.description:
Sets the Object[objectPos].Value
at index to the value of value

Copy object.description:
Copies count objects from
startIndex to copyOffset

Load Stage.description:
Loads a stage based on
Stage.ListPos and Stage.ActiveList

Set Layer Deformation.body: SetLayerDeformation(${3:int deformID, ${4:int deformA}, ${5:int deformB}, ${6:int type}, ${7:int offset}, ${8:int count})
description: Sets the deformation of the
deformation data array of deformID
based on the deform values

Get tile layer entry.body: GetTileLayerEntry(${3:var chunkStore}, ${4:int layer}, ${5: int chunkX}, ${6: int chunkY})
description: Gets the chunkID of the chunk at
chunkX,chunkY on tilelayer layer
and stores it in chunkStore

Set tile layer entry.body: SetTileLayerEntry(${3:int value}, ${4:int layer}, ${5: int chunkX}, ${6: int chunkY})
description: Sets the chunkID of the chunk at
chunkX,chunkY on tilelayer layer
and sets the index to value
Gets the info of infoType of the tile at
tileX, tileY and stores it in store
the IDs for info tile are:
0 - TILEINFO_INDEX
1 - TILEINFO_DIRECTION
2 - TILEINFO_VISUALPLANE
3 - TILEINFO_SOLIDITYA
4 - TILEINFO_SOLIDITYB
5 - TILEINFO_FLAGSA
6 - TILEINFO_ANGLEA
7 - TILEINFO_FLAGSB
8 - TILEINFO_ANGLEB
is recommended to make aliases for the IDs
for a cleaner code
Sets the info of infoType of the tile at
tileX, tileY based on value
the IDs for info tile are:
0 - TILEINFO_INDEX
1 - TILEINFO_DIRECTION
2 - TILEINFO_VISUALPLANE
3 - TILEINFO_SOLIDITYA
4 - TILEINFO_SOLIDITYB
5 - TILEINFO_FLAGSA
6 - TILEINFO_ANGLEA
7 - TILEINFO_FLAGSB
8 - TILEINFO_ANGLEB
is recommended to make aliases for the IDs
for a cleaner code
Copies the tileset image data
of sourceTile into destTile
used for animated tiles

Check current stage folder.description:
set CheckResult to true if
the loaded stage's folder matches checkFolder

Check touch screen input.description:
Check if there was a touch input between
the inputted coordinates

Sin.description:
Gets the value from sin512
lookup table based on angle and sets it in store

Cos.description:
Gets the value from cos512
lookup table based on angle and sets it in store

Sin256.description:
Gets the value from sin256
lookup table based on angle and sets it in store

Cos256.description:
Gets the value from cos256
lookup table based on angle and sets it in store

Arctangent.description:
Performs an arctan operation
using x and y, storing the result in store

Get Bit.description:
Gets bit at index bitPos from value
and stores it in store

Set Bit.description:
Sets bit at index pos to set
and updates value accordingly

Get random value.description:
Gets a random value from 0 to max(not included)
and stores it in store

Negate a value.description:
Performs a NOT operation on value
and updates it (value = -Value)

Absolute value.description:
Gets the absolute number of value
and updates value with the new number

Get table value.description:
Gets a value from table at index
and stores it in store

Set table value.description: Sets the value in table at index to value

description: Linearly interpolates (LERPs)
x and y by percent and stores
the result in store.
percent is 0 through 256

Double interpolation.body: InterpolateXY(${3:var storeX}, ${4:var storeY}, ${5:int aX}, ${6:int aY}, ${7:int bX}, ${8:int bY}, ${9:int percent})
Double interpolation.description:
InterpolateXY does 2 at once
for points (aX, aY) and (bX, bY)

Set identity matrix.description:
Sets the matrix of matID
to the identity state

Multiply matrix.description:
Multiplies matrixA by matrixB
and stores the result in matrixA

v3 Translate matrix XYZ.description:
Translates matrix to x,y,z
all shifted 8 bits (0x100 = 1.0)

v3 Scale matrix XYZ.description:
Scales matrix to x,y,z
all shifted 8 bits (0x100 = 1.0)

v4 Translate matrix XYZ.description:
Translates matrix to x,y,z
all shifted 8 bits (0x100 = 1.0)

v4 Scale matrix XYZ.description:
Scales matrix to x,y,z
all shifted 8 bits (0x100 = 1.0)

description: Rotates matrix to angle on the specified axis
Angles are 512-based, similar to sin/cos
Rotates matrix to angle on the specified axis
Angles are 512-based, similar to sin/cos

Inverse matrix.description: Performs an inversion on matrix's values

Transform vertices.description:
Transform all vertices from
startIndex to endIndex using matrix

Draw 3D Scene.description: Draws the active 3DScene data to the screen

Load text font.description:
Loads a bitmap font from filePath
for use with textMenus

Load text file.description:
Loads a menu based on the file
loaded from filePath

description: Sets up menu with rowCount rows,
selectionCount active selections
and aligning to alignment
Adds an entry to menu with the
contents of text, and highlighted
if highlightEntry is set to true
Edits an entry to menu with the
contents of text in rowID, and highlighted
if highlightEntry is set to true
Gets the data of type from menu using index,
using offset if the type is TEXTINFO_TEXTDATA
type ids are:
TEXTINFO_TEXTDATA
TEXTINFO_TEXTSIZE
TEXTINFO_ROWCOUNT

Draw menu.description:
Draws menu to XPos & YPos
relative to the screen

Draw text.body: DrawText(${3|MENU_1,MENU_2|}, ${4:int XPos}, ${5:int YPos}, ${6:int scale}, ${7:int spacing}, ${8:int rowStart}, ${9:int rowCount})
description: Draws the contents of rowCount rows
starting from rowStart in menu to XPos & YPos
relative to the screen, using spacing pixels
between them and using scale scaling

Get version number.description:
Adds a text entry with the game's version
as the text, highlighted if highlight is set

Send engine callback w/ two parameters.description: Sends callback to engine with 2 parameters

Send engine callback w/ four parameters.body: EngineCallback4(${3:int callbackFuncID}, ${4:int param1}, ${5:int param2}, ${6:int param3}, ${7:int param4})
Send engine callback w/ four parameters.description: Sends callback to engine with 4 parameters

description: reads the contents of the save file
on disk into SaveRAM (overwrites any existing values)

Write saved RAM.description: writes the contents of the save file on disk

Load online menu.description:
Loads the data for the specified online menu
Only useful in the original CD 2011

Set achievement.description:
Sets the status of the achievement
with index of id to status

Set leaderboard.description:
Sets the entry of the leaderboard
with index of id to entry
